page.title: 16Schools
page.content: There is only one school in our area: a primary school in Lower Stoke Holy Cross (GR229018) which takes children aged 4-11 from Lower and Upper Stoke Holy Cross, Caistor St. Edmunds and Shotesham. It has a staff of 1 headteacher, and five assistants. They transfer to Framlingham Earl High School from the age of 11-16. The children from Swardeston travel to Mulbarton First School (4-8yrs) Mulbarton Middle School (8-12yrs) and Hethersett High School (11-16yrs) Newton Flotman Primary School takes the children from Swainsthorpe from 4-11, whilst those aged 11-16 attend Long Stratton High School. All travel by motor coach. Those requiring further education after 16 attend the Norwich City College and then proceed to University or College of Further Education.
